intro: Schwartzia antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian schwartzia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale in color, and it produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Due to habitat loss, Schwartzia antioquensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
